column4: Title
Someone asked me the other day if my tropical garden where I teach watercolor paint nights is "magical." I'll let the pictures speak for themselves.

Head over to the site (HawaiiArtClasses.com) to register for Christmas Workshops....with a tropical flair! Any two Christmas workshop registrations gets you 20% off automatically in the cart. So you can sign yourself up for two or more workshops. Sign up you and a friend. Sign up two kids. Doesn't matter as long as it's two. Woohoo!

All classes are suitable for ages 9 and up. Location is my home-based studio in Waipahu. It's cozy and breezy (at the same time - IYKYK), and there will be Chai!

-Wreaths & card projects are in my faaaavorite type of paint - Watercolor! (with a touch of gouache and shimmery stuff!) 

-Creative Open Studio times have a variety of materials available for your open-ended creative projects you've been itching to make. I know you have them! And I'm happy to help you bring them to life!

If you've registered for classes or private lessons this year, be on the lookout for an email about a special thank-you event one of these upcoming weekends. You guys are awesome, and I'm so grateful to be a part of you and your kids' art journeys this year!

I thought this video (link in comments) was really thoughtful when it comes to genuine art content on the internet. If you have a young artist who is learning by a lot of videos, especially if they have "favorites," this would be a good video to watch with them.

Y'all, I just got a business landline. 🤣 It turns out I couldn't get an 808 area code through my cell provider! And I didn't want to change the cell number I've had for a Very Long Time.  But I also wanted an 808 area code for my art lessons!  And I didn't want my personal cell number on everything!! So now I have an 808 business LAND line. Suffice to say, my kids are mystified at this two-wire contraption that can't leave the house. But I'm kinda digging that early-aughts look!

I'm about to update my online listings with this phone number, so let's see how long it takes to start getting the spammers and scammers! (Anyone for less than 24 hrs? 72? Less than a week for sure!)

P.S. You can still text my cell if you have it, no worries!
There are lots of creative, handmade gifts and art at this place in Kapolei if you're looking for something unique!

Something fun to discuss: https://www.centraloregondaily.com/news/local/colbert-bend-googly-eye-bandit/article_e7f57428-b994-11ef-b2ee-2b4ff6ac1de1.htm

My take....Art put in public places should inherently expect to be subject to the additions and opinions of the public. Sometimes it's graffitied and torn down (as in the example of statues of southern Confederate generals). Sometimes it's torn out of the sides of buildings and auctioned off (as in the example of Banksy's graffiti). And sometimes it gets googly eyes stuck to it. 

The last one is my personal favorite. If I ever do a mural, I hope the public adds giant googly eyes to it. 

Actually, maybe I'll just straight-up add them myself. I already have them on my studio desk lights!l

Anyone who has been or who had a student in my classes this year is invited to come Saturday for this free event! We'll be making some watercolor cards and gift tags! Check your email for the special invite and to register for an hour time slot! :-) Bring your 'ohana (but please stay with the kids). And Mele Kalikimaka if I don't see you by then! 

P.S. There's also ornament making for 'ohana (ages 5+ and their grownups) on Sunday for just $10. Space is limited. Just say "I want to come!" below if you want the link to register!

#hawaiiartclasses #melekalikimaka #artlessons #watercolorlesson #waipahu #ohana #oahuevents #hawaiiartist

column4:
Who else is multitasking on O'ahu today?! The Eddie is ON! I love Luke and his story but I'm also rooting for a wahine win! Thanks to the hosts for talking about using local artists for the event & organization! 🤙

#oahuartist #theeddie #anthurium #watercolor #hawaiiartclasses

I don't often actually record how long I spend on a drawing or painting. But today I happened to have it going on my screen cast while I prepped my drawing and worked on a value study. Two hours and forty-one minutes and I'm not actually done prepping for what will ultimately be a watercolor painting of these orchids. Loving it though....shout out to Sophia who asked about my secret orchid paintings I've been keeping to myself for years. She made me realize how much I desire a complicated watercolor project. I'm excited to try it on canvas!

#oahuartist #hawaiiartist #orchidlover #orchidshow

Stuff I did this weekend: 
✅The lovely #roadtohana with my family...and back again (and btw, it's not that bad if you've got a country boy driving ya while you passenger princess) 🤣
✅Painted red sand and turquoise waters on #Kaihalulu Beach (it's not as vibrantly red as many photos out there lead you to believe)
✅Attended koholā party in Ma'alaea Bay
✅Paddled outrigger canoe and watched the sun rise over the mountains
✅Investigated "weird" washed-up things on the beach, like wana and ula poni
✅Held a giant parrot in my hands, on each shoulder, and on my head. At the same time. (Don't tell my #Waipahu chicken friends, but I loved the parrots more.)
✅Bought #maui chocolate, mandarins, manzanas, and coconut candy from roadside stands
✅Itched to get back to an orchid painting I started last week
✅Didn't watch TV or the ongoing telenovela americana, and it was fahhhhhbulous.

P.S. I have manually adjusted the color and contrast in this photo to look more like what I saw IRL, but IG might be adding a label required by Meta as "using AI." It's exactly the type of simple edit I did before "AI" existed - the type of settings that were available in all photo-editing software for all time. I guess they're calling it by a different name now. At any rate, it was 100% taken by my husband on his phone and adjusted manually by me in my phone's original camera app to look more accurate than the camera's color and contrast processing. I never use AI to fake stuff, just to occasionally edit things I've personally written to make them more clear and concise. But not this, as you can probably tell by my long-winded paragraph with the subversive insinuation that I have an ongoing annoyance with disgenuous "influencer" photos.
#hawaiiartclasses #oahuartist #hawaii #hawaiitravel

It's a socks-n-slippahs kind of week in Hawai'i. Lucky I own socks!! I want to record some paintings and tutorials in my studio, but my studio is in my garage and IT IS SO COLD out there!! I may need to join Studio Dog in the sun to do emails and such instead.
Rebecca Block Art and Design updated her profile picture.

The reason I switched from acrylics and oils to watercolor around 2017 was partly because of ease of cleanup with small kids around. But I also REALLY needed to use my brain in ways that reminded me I was more than a caretaker for small children. The learning curve of watercolor worked my brain in ways that were incredibly fulfilling in a different sort of way than momming all day. It kept me from going insane, to be honest. And I'm drawn to orchids because they're a very complicated-looking flower. Yep, I like a challenge! Here are three I've been personally hoarding on my walls, but I think I can relinquish them now. ;-) Comment below if you're interested and I'll message prices for these originals. As I'm in Hawai'i, they will ship as just the painting.

#orchidshow #orchids #cattleya #phalaenopsis #hawaii #oahu #oahuhawaii #nature #boldandbeautiful #tropicalgarden #orchidlover #hawaiiart #tropicalart

Do you have a young artist who is thinking about selling their artwork online? I started a blog recently and I just published a post with some advice based on my experience. Lots of resource links in there, too! (Link in comments below)

For many years, I've already been trying to source my supplies from companies that manufacture in the US, Europe, or Japan. Especially when it comes to paint - there's just some places I don't trust to be safe. My own personal brushes also come from these places. However, good quality *class* sets of brushes are one of the few things I can't find made in the US! (If anyone knows of some, please share your knowledge!) There's a set I like from a store on the continent. Even if all their stuff is made in China, I actually really like this one. I regretted not getting a refreshed set of brushes on my last trip there. So my fabulous sister-and-bro-in-law just hooked me up from one of the stores on The 9th Island. 😘 The speed at which this puppy arrived is impressive! THANKS, SIS!! 😁

Studio tour time! It was super clean Monday before classes started back up, so I thought it was about time to take some pics! The right side is where I make; the left side is where I teach. And YES, IT'S A GARAGE! 😁 Cuz that's how we roll. I realize it sounds weird if you don't live here, but space is at a premium here so it's pretty common to use your garage space for gatherings. And I like having the fresh air, neighbor chats, and chicken friends strolling by. Besides, of all the garages I've seen in Hawaii, I propose this one is a top contender for "most interesting views from the street." Check out the link in the comments to see more pics with captions. (Good for showing your kids before they come to class!)

 #orchidartwork #orchidartist #orchidart #natureartists #natureartworks #natureartwork #natureartist #natureart #studiotour #hawaiiartclasses #artlessonsforadults #artlessonsforteens #artlessons #artlessonsforkids #ArtLessons #waipahu #oahulifestyle #oahulife #hawaiilifestyle #hawaiilife

column4:
General reminder about registering for private lessons: As it says on the website, if you've purchased private lessons, the next step is *scheduling* the lessons. I usually email within the hour to say hello and ask you about days and times you want to do your lessons. So if you think you haven't heard from me, please first check your spam folder and/or search for "private art lessons" or "Rebecca Block" or "Hawai'i Art Classes" in your email. If you STILL don't see it, please contact me via email or phone! I also try calling and texting folks if I haven't heard from them yet. You can pick any of those forms of communication. You can use the form on my website (www.hawaiiartclasses.com), or you can call my studio line at 808-671-0295.

Eventually, I will have to assume that perhaps someone changed their mind or they were confused about something. (If this is the case, it is always best to just reach out to me!) After one month of not hearing from someone about scheduling their lesson, I will refund the registration fee because I don't want to have an obligation hanging over my head with someone I can't get ahold of. Thanks for understanding!
Check out my top seven painting exercises so you can get to know your own paint set and totally level up your artwork. Fresh off the blog! (Link in comments)
